content:
…an Applied Scientist at Amazon, part of the APP (Analytics, Performance & Programs) Machine Learning and Engineering team, focusing on optimisation and machine learning problems. Previously, I was an Advanced AI Scientist at BenevolentAI working on machine learning solutions for drug discovery.
I was a DPhil candidate part of the Statistical Genetics group working with Prof. Pier Palamara at the University of Oxford and I recently graduated with a PhD in Statistics. Prior to that, I studied at Telecom Paris and Eurecom, and I was then a graduate student enrolled in the MSc By Research in Statistics at the University of Oxford..
Email : thiziri [dot] naitsaada [at] maths [dot] ox [dot] ac [dot] uk
summary:
… an Applied Mathematics PhD Candidate in the Data Science group of the Mathematical Institute at the University of Oxford advised by Prof. Jared Tanner.
My PhD research focuses on theories of Deep Learing. In particular, I am interested in the study of infinitely wide neural networks and possible optimal initialisation schemes.
I also have some interests in Geometrical Machine Learning methods, as such as applications of Deep Learning models to solve public health issues.(e.
title: Thiziri Nait Saada

authors: J. Nait Saada, A. Hu and P. Palamara
title: Inference of pairwise coalescence times and allele ages using deep neural networks.
